snippet: Amr Moussa, a former Egyptian foreign minister who served under President Hosni Mubarak, is trying to make a strength from the liability of his long government career.
abstract: Amr Moussa, a former Egyptian foreign minister who served under Pres Hosni Mubarak, is locked in a race for president with two Islamists; Moussa has positioned himself as the experienced, tolerant choice; he has railed against what he calls the proposed 'experiment' in Islamist government, and has portrayed himself as the only candidate who can deliver stability to Egypt.

byline.contributor: Dina Saleh Amer contributed reporting from Shirbeen, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Amr Moussa, a former Egyptian foreign minister who served under President Hosni Mubarak, is trying to make a strength from the liability of his long government career.

headline.seo: In Egypt, Amr Moussa Makes an Insider’s Run for President
headline.main: Candidate in Egypt Makes an Insider’s Run for President
headline.print_headline: Presidential Candidate Out to Show Egypt It Needs Him Back on the Inside

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
